docs.snippet: Serie A table-proppers Catania have sacked hapless coach Rolando Maran for the second time this season and Cagliari have fired Diego Lopez following defeats at the weekend.
docs.lead_paragraph: Serie A table-proppers Catania have sacked hapless coach Rolando Maran for the second time this season and Cagliari have fired Diego Lopez following defeats at the weekend.

headline.main: Catania Sack Maran Again, Cagliari Fire Lopez
headline.print_headline: Catania Sack Maran Again, Cagliari Fire Lopez

docs.snippet: Like sunshine and happiness or Lennon and McCartney, football and Brazil go together, each making the other better. So the first World Cup in Brazil in 64 years is bound to be special.
docs.lead_paragraph: Like sunshine and happiness or Lennon and McCartney, football and Brazil go together, each making the other better. So the first World Cup in Brazil in 64 years is bound to be special.

headline.main: Cue Samba: Brazil's World Cup Bound to Be Special
headline.print_headline: Cue Samba: Brazil's World Cup Bound to Be Special

docs.snippet: Playing in front of its own fans, Brazil is expected to easily advance from Group A, leaving Croatia, Mexico and Cameroon fighting for the other spot in the second round.
docs.lead_paragraph: Playing in front of its own fans, Brazil is expected to easily advance from Group A, leaving Croatia, Mexico and Cameroon fighting for the other spot in the second round.

headline.main: At Home, Brazil Clear Favorite to Win Group A
headline.print_headline: At Home, Brazil Clear Favorite to Win Group A

docs.snippet: Ange Postecoglou cherishes memories of watching the 1974 World Cup on a small black-and-white TV with his dad, recalling how that shared experience when he was 9 helped transform him into an ardent Australia supporter.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ange Postecoglou cherishes memories of watching the 1974 World Cup on a small black-and-white TV with his dad, recalling how that shared experience when he was 9 helped transform him into an ardent Australia supporter.

headline.main: Australia Coach Looking for Positive Play at WCup
headline.print_headline: Australia Coach Looking for Positive Play at WCup

docs.snippet: Australia will be returning for its third consecutive World Cup with its toughest assignment to date — Group B matches against defending champion Spain, 2010 finalist Netherlands and Chile.
docs.lead_paragraph: Australia will be returning for its third consecutive World Cup with its toughest assignment to date — Group B matches against defending champion Spain, 2010 finalist Netherlands and Chile.

headline.main: 5 Australia Players to Watch at the World Cup
headline.print_headline: 5 Australia Players to Watch at the World Cup

docs.snippet: On the field, Brazil is ready for the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: On the field, Brazil is ready for the World Cup.

headline.main: Brazil Ready to Play for World Cup Title at Home
headline.print_headline: Brazil Ready to Play for World Cup Title at Home

docs.snippet: Playing at home, Brazil will be attracting more attention than usual at the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Playing at home, Brazil will be attracting more attention than usual at the World Cup.

docs.snippet: A prisoner held 12 years without charge at the Guantanamo Bay U.S. naval base made his case for release Tuesday in front of a new U.S. government review board.
docs.lead_paragraph: A prisoner held 12 years without charge at the Guantanamo Bay U.S. naval base made his case for release Tuesday in front of a new U.S. government review board.

headline.main: Guantanamo Prisoner Appeals to Panel for Release
headline.print_headline: Guantanamo Prisoner Appeals to Panel for Release

docs.snippet: Prisoners in the jails of Uruguay will be able to use marijuana if a doctor says it will benefit their health.
docs.lead_paragraph: Prisoners in the jails of Uruguay will be able to use marijuana if a doctor says it will benefit their health.

headline.main: Uruguay to Give Medicinal Marijuana to Prisoners
headline.print_headline: Uruguay to Give Medicinal Marijuana to Prisoners

docs.snippet: Colombia is the favorite in Group C, there's not much doubt about that. That leaves Greece, Ivory Coast and Japan to play for the group's other spot in the round of 16 at this year's World Cup in Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia is the favorite in Group C, there's not much doubt about that. That leaves Greece, Ivory Coast and Japan to play for the group's other spot in the round of 16 at this year's World Cup in Brazil.

headline.main: Colombia Favored in Group C of World Cup
